title: Culham Lock Walk Route

images.title: Claire Ward / Culham Lock
images.caption: Culham Lock. In the top right corner of the grid square, Culham Lock is one of the 44 manned locks on the river Thames, (although the lock keeper seen here in the white hat is a female). This stretch of the Thames that cuts across the top of the grid square is called Culham Cut. The lock was built of stone by the Thames Navigation Commission in 1809.

images.title: Rod Allday / Culham Lock
images.caption: The upstream end of Culham Lock on the River Thames at Culham, Oxfordshire

images.title: Culham church by Philip Halling, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Culham church

images.title: The Green, Culham by Philip Halling, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Green, Culham. The parish includes Culham Science Centre and Europa School UK, which is the only Accredited European School within the United Kingdom. The 800,000 square metre scientific research site includes two nuclear fusion experiments: JET and MAST.

images.title: Footbridge at Culham by Row17, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footbridge at Culham

images.title: New Culham bridge by Bill Nicholls, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: New Culham bridge

images.title: Bill Nicholls / Culham Manor
images.caption: The west wing of Culham Manor was built in the 15th century as a medieval grange for Abingdon Abbey. It is half-timbered, with a stone ground floor and timber-framed first floor. The 17th-century north front also survives. The house is a Grade II* Listed building.

description: A short circular walk around the delightful Oxfordshire village of Culham, passing the 15th century Culham Manor and the picturesque Culham Lock on the River Thames. You can start the walk from the free lock car park by the river. Then follow paths across Sutton Bridge to Sutton Pools to the north of the neighbouring village of Sutton Courtenay. You'll pass the picturesque weir and manor house before heading through the village and returning to the car park. For a longer walk in the area try the Abingdon Circular Walk which starts from the nearby town.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head east along the river and you will soon come to the neighbouring village of Clifton Hampden. The historic riverside settlement is well worth a visit with delightful thatched cottages, a listed 19th century bridge, a fine 14th century pub and a noteworthy church with elements dating back to the 12th century.

display_address: Culham Lock Car Park, Culham, South Oxfordshire, Oxfordshire, England, OX14 4NB, United Kingdom
